wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Nice post. Interestingly enough, the most statically typed languages are functional languages with strong type inference that removes almost any need for type declaration (Haskell, F#, etc). Funny enough, these functional languages come with REPLs just like the dynamic languages, so in the end, one must conclude it isn't static vs. dynamic; it's "script" languages that rule the world. ;)
